Answers.MP Summary: interact with a EWMH/NetWM compatible X Window Manager.
Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: List all windows, managed by the window manager
Top-3 Similar Questions: so_1188959: How to open a new tab in GNOME Terminal from command line?
so_31383091: open new tab in current window using shell script
Top-3 Scripts:
so_1188959: #!/bin/sh

WID=$(xprop -root | grep "_NET_ACTIVE_WINDOW(WINDOW)"| awk '{print $5}')
xdotool windowfocus $WID
xdotool key ctrl+shift+t
wmctrl -i -a $WID

so_31383091: set WID=`xprop -root | grep "_NET_ACTIVE_WINDOW(WINDOW)"| awk '{print $5}'`
xdotool windowfocus $WID
xdotool key ctrl+shift+t
wmctrl -i -a $WID

Explanations about Options.-a:
Switch to the desktop containing the window <WIN>, raise the window, and give it
 focus.
Explanations about Options.-i:
Interpret window arguments (<WIN>) as a numeric value rather than a string name for
 the window. If the numeric value starts with the prefix '0x' it is assumed to be a
 hexadecimal number.
